events.originalText: Syrian civil war: The Syrian Democratic Forces, assisted by the U.S. military, captured the Tabqa Dam and surrounding countryside, completing the Battle of Tabqa.
events.subtitle: Syrian civil war
events.headline: Syrian Democratic Forces Capture Tabqa Dam with U.S. Military Assistance

events.originalText: One World Trade Center in New York City, the tallest building in the Western Hemisphere, was topped out at a height of 1,776 feet (541 m).
events.subtitle: One World Trade Center
events.headline: One World Trade Center Topped Out at 1,776 Feet in New York City

events.originalText: Vladimir Arutyunian attempted to assassinate U.S. president George W. Bush and Georgian president Mikheil Saakashvili in Tbilisi using a hand grenade, which failed to detonate.
events.subtitle: Vladimir Arutyunian
events.headline: Assassination Attempt on U.S. President George W. Bush and Georgian President Mikheil Saakashvili in Tbilisi

events.originalText: An earthquake registering 7.3 Mw struck near Qaen, Iran, killing at least 1,567 and leaving around 50,000 others homeless.
events.subtitle: 1997 Qayen earthquake
events.headline: 7.3 Magnitude Earthquake Strikes Near Qaen, Iran, Killing 1,567

events.originalText: American serial killer John Wayne Gacy was executed by lethal injection for the murders of twelve teenage boys and young men in a series of killings committed between 1972 and 1978.
events.subtitle: John Wayne Gacy
events.headline: Serial Killer John Wayne Gacy Executed for Murders of Twelve Teenage Boys

events.originalText: World War II: German Deputy Führer Rudolf Hess parachuted into Scotland in an attempt to negotiate peace with the British government.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: German Deputy Führer Rudolf Hess Parachutes into Scotland in Peace Negotiation Attempt

events.originalText: British prime minister Neville Chamberlain resigned and formally recommended Winston Churchill as his successor.
events.subtitle: Neville Chamberlain
events.headline: British Prime Minister Neville Chamberlain Resigns, Recommends Winston Churchill as Successor

events.originalText: World War II: German forces commenced their invasion of Belgium.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: German Forces Invade Belgium in World War II

events.originalText: Ernest Shackleton and five companions arrived at South Georgia, completing a 1,300 km (800 mi) lifeboat voyage over 16 days to obtain rescue for the Imperial Trans-Antarctic Expedition.
events.subtitle: Ernest Shackleton
events.headline: Ernest Shackleton Completes 1,300 km Lifeboat Voyage to South Georgia for Rescue

events.originalText: Siamese–Vietnamese wars: Lê Văn Khôi escaped from prison to begin a revolt against Emperor Minh Mạng, primarily to avenge his adoptive father, Vietnamese general Lê Văn Duyệt.
events.subtitle: Siamese–Vietnamese wars
events.headline: Lê Văn Khôi Escapes Prison to Revolt Against Emperor Minh Mạng in Siamese–Vietnamese Wars

events.originalText: American Revolutionary War: A small force of Patriots led by Ethan Allen and Benedict Arnold captured Fort Ticonderoga (depicted) in New York, without significant injury or incident.
events.subtitle: American Revolutionary War
events.headline: Patriots Capture Fort Ticonderoga in New York During American Revolutionary War

events.originalText: Dutch explorer Pieter Nuyts was appointed governor of Formosa (modern-day Taiwan) by the Dutch East India Company.
events.subtitle: Pieter Nuyts
events.headline: Pieter Nuyts Appointed Governor of Formosa by Dutch East India Company

events.originalText: Chinese astronomers during the Han dynasty made the first precisely dated observation of a sunspot.
events.subtitle: Chinese astronomy
events.headline: Han Dynasty Astronomers Make First Precisely Dated Observation of Sunspot
